title: Swiggy to launch Instamart as separate app, eyes multi-app strategy on quick commerce boom - Moneycontrol
summary:
Swiggy to launch Instamart as separate app, eyes multi-app strategy on quick commerce boom

Date: January 09, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Food and grocery delivery platform Swiggy will launch its quick commerce offering Instamart as a separate app aimed at evolving customer preferences, according to group CEO and co-founder Sriharsha Majety.

  • Swiggy looks to build a multi-app strategy, similar to models by Meituan and Alibaba.
  • Instamart will also remain available on the main Swiggy app.
  • CEO Sriharsha Majety states that Instamart could potentially surpass food delivery in user base.
“We are in an unchartered territory and we are taking a zero-based view of the market.” - Sriharsha Majety

This launch reflects Swiggy's efforts to adapt to a rapidly changing market landscape.
newTitle: Swiggy Launches Instamart as a Separate App to Enhance Quick Commerce Strategy

Stock Market Live Updates 9 January 2025: Sensex, Nifty fall amid sustained selling pressure, dragged by banking stocks - BusinessLine
summary:
Stock Market Live Updates 9 January 2025: Sensex, Nifty fall amid sustained selling pressure, dragged by banking stocks

Date: January 9, 2025

Source: The Hindu BusinessLine

The Indian equity markets experienced a significant decline with the Sensex dropping over 500 points due to heavy selling pressure, particularly in the banking sector, amid negative sentiment from foreign institutional investors.

  • As of 1 p.m., Sensex decreased by 492.47 points (0.63%) to 77,656.02.
  • Nifty fell by 157.85 points (0.67%) to 23,531.10.
  • Foreign Institutional Investors offloaded ₹3,362 crore worth of equities, amplifying market pressure.
  • ONGC led declines on the NSE while Hindustan Unilever managed to gain amid the broader market drop.
“The Nifty is being closely watched at the key support level of 23,500, crucial for future market direction.”

In conclusion, today's market shift reflects growing concerns over global economic conditions and investor sentiment, highlighting the banking sector's pivotal role in market movements.
newTitle: Stock Market Updates: Sensex and Nifty Decline Amid Banking Sector Struggles

title: Meta’s fact-checking snub in US sets off alarm bells for fact-checkers in India - The Indian Express
summary:
Meta’s fact-checking snub in US sets off alarm bells for fact-checkers in India

Publication Date: January 9, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

Meta's recent decision to end its third-party fact-checking programme in the US has raised alarm bells for fact-checkers in India, as many rely on funding from Meta, fearing they could face significant operational challenges.

  • Meta announced the cessation of its third-party fact-checking programme in the U.S., pivoting to a community-driven model.
  • Fact-checkers in India fear potential funding cuts, as many rely on Meta for financial support.
  • The survival of these fact-checking entities is threatened if they cannot access Meta's platforms for visibility.
  • Meta works with 12 fact-checking partners in India, including notable organizations and smaller firms.
  • Uncertainty looms over whether Meta will implement similar changes in India.
“This is possibly the biggest existential threat many fact checkers will have to contend with,” a senior executive from a fact-checking organisation stated anonymously.

The shift in Meta's strategy underscores the growing concerns about the future of independent fact-checking, especially in developing contexts like India.
newTitle: Meta’s Fact-Checking Shift Raises Concerns for India

GTPL Hathway, SRF, Navin Fluorine, Borosil Renewables, Kalyan Jewellers, Swiggy, Oil India: Check top buzzing stocks of the day - Upstox
summary:
Top Buzzing Stocks of the Day: GTPL Hathway, SRF, Navin Fluorine, and More

Date: January 9, 2024

Source: Upstox

The stock market experienced declines with notable movements in several stocks today, particularly in the chemicals and technology sectors.

  • SRF and Navin Fluorine saw significant increases of up to 15% due to rising prices for refrigerant gases.
  • MobiKwik reported a net loss in its recent earnings but saw a revenue increase of 42.8%.
  • GTPL Hathway shares rose over 12% as the company prepared to announce its quarterly results.
  • Borosil Renewables plans a 50% capacity expansion in solar glass manufacturing and hit a 5% circuit limit.
  • Manappuram Finance shares surged following the lifting of RBI restrictions on a subsidiary.
  • Swiggy shares rallied over 6% as Bernstein issued a positive outlook on its valuations.
“Swiggy's current valuations seem reasonable, with the potential for its shares to re-rate.” - Bernstein

This trading session highlighted the volatility in the markets with several stocks showing significant gains despite the overall negative trend.
newTitle: Top Buzzing Stocks of the Day: GTPL Hathway, SRF, Navin Fluorine, and More

title: Equity MF inflows rose 15% to Rs 41,000 crore in Dec, debt funds saw outflows of Rs 1.27 lakh crore - The Economic Times
summary:
Equity MF inflows rose 15% to Rs 41,000 crore in Dec, debt funds saw outflows of Rs 1.27 lakh crore

Publication Date: December 2024

Source: Economic Times

The mutual fund industry recorded a net outflow of Rs 80,509 crore in December 2024, along with an impressive 15% month-on-month increase in equity mutual fund inflows, reaching Rs 41,155 crore.

  • Equity mutual funds saw inflows rise from Rs 35,943 crore in November to Rs 41,155 crore in December.
  • Sectoral and thematic funds attracted the highest inflows totaling Rs 15,331 crore.
  • In CY24, equity mutual funds had total inflows of Rs 3.94 lakh crore.
  • Debt funds experienced a notable outflow of Rs 1.27 lakh crore.
  • Hybrid mutual funds saw a 6% increase in inflows, reaching Rs 4,369 crore.
  • The overall assets under management (AUM) decreased by 2% to Rs 66.66 lakh crore in December.
“Liquid funds observed the highest outflow in December, amounting to Rs 66,532 crore.”

In conclusion, while equity mutual funds demonstrated strong growth in December, the debt segment faced significant withdrawals, highlighting varied investor confidence in different fund categories.
newTitle: Equity MF Inflows Rise 15% to Rs 41,000 Crore in December

title: TCS Q3 Results LIVE: Tata Consultancy Services to report earnings today, shares decline - Upstox
Sensex falls over 500 pts, Nifty below 23,550: Pessimism over Fed rate cut, Q3 jitters among key factors... - Moneycontrol
summary:
Sensex falls over 500 pts, Nifty below 23,550: Pessimism over Fed rate cut, Q3 jitters among key factors behind market decline today

Date: January 09, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The equity markets in India traded lower as the benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty declined, following cautious investor sentiment and global cues ahead of the December quarter earnings season.

  • The BSE Sensex fell 513.72 points or 0.65% at 77,634.77.
  • The NSE Nifty slipped 164.75 points or 0.69% at 23,524.20.
  • Key laggards included Tata Motors, Larsen & Toubro, and Zomato.
  • Investors are cautious ahead of Tata Consultancy Services' Q3 results announcement.
“With the Q3 results season starting today, markets will react to corporate performance. The results of TCS will provide insight into the IT sector’s outlook.” - Dr. V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services.

The equity markets continue to react to global economic factors, with investors remaining alert as the earnings season progresses.
newTitle: Sensex Falls Over 500 Points Amid Fed Rate Cut Concerns

Zomato shares may rise 22% backed by food delivery, Blinkit’s GMV growth: Kotak Equities - The Economic Times
summary:
Zomato shares may rise 22% backed by food delivery, Blinkit’s GMV growth: Kotak Equities

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Economic Times

Driven by the growth of Zomato’s food delivery business and Blinkit’s GMV, domestic brokerage firm Kotak Institutional Equities has retained its ‘buy’ rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 305, as it expects the company to report a decent third quarter.

This suggests an upside potential of 22.3% from the stock’s current levels.

  • Kotak Equities expects food delivery to report a sequential contribution margin improvement, driven by higher platform fees.
  • Rapid store additions in Blinkit and higher customer acquisition costs may weigh on EBITDA margins.
  • The brokerage anticipates a 19% YoY growth in food delivery GMV and a solid 114% YoY growth in Blinkit GMV.
  • The contribution margin is forecasted to reach 7.8% of GMV, showing an improvement of 20 basis points quarter-over-quarter.
  • Adjusted EBITDA margin is expected to expand from 3.5% to 3.7% of GMV.
  • Blinkit’s GMV is projected to surge 114% year-over-year, with a 124% revenue increase.
  • Contribution margin of Blinkit remains steady at 3.8%, but EBITDA loss is expected to widen to Rs 13.2 crore.
“The Blinkit business continues to scale well, driven by new store additions and improving customer engagement. Blinkit’s profitability will be deferred due to near-term competitive intensity.” - Garima Mishra, Kotak Equities

In conclusion, Zomato's investments in various sectors could create additional value in the medium term, establishing a positive outlook for the company's growth trajectory.
newTitle: Zomato shares may rise 22% backed by food delivery, Blinkit’s GMV growth: Kotak Equities

title: ‘How long can you stare at your wife?’: L&T chairman says he wants employees to work on Sunday too - Hindustan Times
summary:
'How long can you stare at your wife?': L&T chairman says he wants employees to work on Sunday too

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The chairman of Larsen & Toubro, SN Subrahmanyan, has caused controversy by suggesting employees should work 90 hours a week, expressing a desire for them to work on Sundays as well.

  • Subrahmanyan stated he regrets employees are not required to work Sundays, saying it would make him happy.
  • He questioned what employees do at home, asking, "How long can you stare at your wife?"
  • He compared work hours in China and the USA, claiming Chinese workers put in 90 hours a week.
  • His comments were criticized on Reddit, with comparisons made to Infosys founder Narayana Murthy's similar statements.
“I regret I am not able to make you work on Sundays. If I can make you work on Sundays, I will be more happy, because I work on Sundays.”

The chairman's remarks have sparked a conversation about work-life balance in the corporate world and the expectations placed on employees.
newTitle: 'How long can you stare at your wife?': L&T chairman says he wants employees to work on Sunday too

"Billionaire Jealousy"? Zuckerberg's Shock Trump Pivot, In Line With Elon Musk - NDTV
summary:
Zuckerberg's Shift to Trumpian Politics Mirrors Musk's Rightward Movement

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: NDTV

Mark Zuckerberg, the CEO of Facebook and Instagram, has made a surprising pivot toward the political right, criticizing censorship and ending fact-checking in the U.S., claims that align him with Trump and Elon Musk.

  • Zuckerberg asserts that Facebook's focus will return to "free expression."
  • The platform is ending its content fact-checking program in the U.S. after prior initiatives following various scandals.
  • This move has drawn criticism and raised questions about Zuckerberg's motives, potentially reflecting a desire to avoid governmental scrutiny.
  • He aims to align himself with Trump, who has publicly criticized him, and the change indicates a significant political realignment.
  • The announcement is seen in the context of Zuckerberg's efforts to strengthen ties with influential figures in Silicon Valley.
  • Tech analysts suggest this may stem from competition with Elon Musk and fears of being sidelined in the tech landscape.
"This is a case of kissing the ring," said tech analyst Carolina Milanesi.

The stakes of this political maneuvering are substantial as Zuckerberg aims to maintain his influential position while navigating the growing tension within Silicon Valley.
newTitle: Zuckerberg's Shift to Trumpian Politics Mirrors Musk's Rightward Movement

title: IREDA shares gain ahead of Q3 results — Here is what to watch out for - CNBCTV18
summary:
IREDA shares gain ahead of Q3 results — Here is what to watch out for

Publication Date: January 9, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of IREDA are trading with gains of over 1% ahead of the announcement of its results for the October-December period. Key metrics such as asset quality and growth in loan sanctions will be closely monitored.

  • IREDA sanctioned loans worth ₹31,087 crore in Q3, a 129% increase from last year.
  • Disbursements stood at ₹17,236 crore, a 41% year-on-year growth.
  • Loan book outstanding increased by 36% to ₹69,000 crore.
  • Gross NPA ratio remains steady at 2.19%; net NPA increased slightly to 1.04%.
  • Net interest income rose 52% year-on-year.
“The company had sanctioned loans worth ₹13,558 crore during the year-ago period.”

The upcoming results are anticipated to provide insights into IREDA's financial health and asset quality.
newTitle: IREDA shares gain ahead of Q3 results — Here is what to watch out for

title: How Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's one sentence wiped out $8 billion in market cap of quantum computing compan - The Times of India
summary:
How Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's one sentence wiped out $8 billion in market cap of quantum computing companies

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

In a surprising turn of events, a statement made by Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, resulted in a significant loss of market capitalization for quantum computing companies, totaling $8 billion.

  • Jensen Huang's remarks about the future of quantum computing prompted a massive sell-off in the stock market.
  • Investors reassessed the viability of quantum computing technologies based on Huang's comment.
  • This development highlights the volatility and sensitivity of the tech market to influential figures' statements.
Huang's comment sent shockwaves through the market.

This incident underscores the profound impact that industry leaders can have on market perceptions and valuations, especially in cutting-edge fields like quantum computing.
newTitle: How Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's Statement Affected Quantum Computing Companies

Tata Motors stock falls 3% despite Nomura, Morgan Stanley's positive JLR outlook - Moneycontrol
summary:
Tata Motors stock falls 3% despite Nomura, Morgan Stanley's positive JLR outlook

Date: January 09, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The shares of Tata Motors fell by 3% to Rs 769 despite positive forecasts from Nomura and Morgan Stanley following Jaguar Land Rover's (JLR) sales updates.

  • JLR's wholesale volumes rose 3% YoY to 1,04,427 units.
  • Retail sales decreased 3% YoY to 1,06,334 units.
  • JLR reported a 20% sequential increase in wholesales from Q2 FY25.
  • High-margin models like Range Rover and Defender accounted for 70% of total wholesale volumes.
“Nomura expects Tata Motors to transition from a net debt position of Rs 22,000 crore in Q2 to achieving net cash of Rs 86 per share by FY27.”

The future outlook remains optimistic for Tata Motors even amidst current stock declines.
newTitle: Tata Motors Stock Drops 3% Despite Positive Outlook from Analysts

title: Rise in US bond yields, strong NDF dollar bids push rupee to record low - Reuters
SRF, Navin Fluorine shares surge 13% each on Thursday — Key factors explained - CNBCTV18
summary:
SRF, Navin Fluorine shares surge 13% each on Thursday — Key factors explained

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

Shares of both SRF Ltd. and Navin Fluorine Ltd. surged by 13% on Thursday, marking the third consecutive day of gains. This surge was driven by price hikes in refrigerant gases.

  • Both stocks reached their upper circuit limits on the day.
  • The increase follows a report from CNBC Awaaz regarding significant price hikes by US gas distributors for refrigerant gases, affecting supply.
  • SRF and Navin Fluorine anticipate increased earnings due to price changes in R32 refrigerant.
  • SRF's capacity for R32 is between 29,000 to 30,000 tonnes, while Navin Fluorine's is close to 4,500 tonnes.
"Every $1 per kilogram change in realisations of the R32 refrigerant could increase SRF's EBITDA by ₹260 crore and Navin Fluorine's EBITDA by ₹77 crore."

In summary, the price increases in refrigerant gases, primarily R32, are expected to significantly benefit both companies financially, contributing to their stock surges.
newTitle: SRF and Navin Fluorine Shares Surge 13% Driven by Price Hikes in Refrigerant Gases

title: Q3 Earnings Preview: Top line growth likely to remain subdued for seventh consecutive quarter - Moneycontrol
summary:
Q3 Earnings Preview: Top Line Growth Likely to Remain Subdued for Seventh Consecutive Quarter

Date: January 09, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Brokerages are forecasting subdued top-line growth for listed firms in the December quarter, marking the seventh consecutive period of such trends. Continued pressure on year-on-year (YoY) profit margins is anticipated, leading to a third straight quarter of sub-10% profit growth.

  • Sectors like automobiles, banks, construction materials, consumer staples, and oil are expected to report weak profits with single-digit growth.
  • In contrast, sectors such as capital goods, pharmaceuticals, real estate, and telecommunications anticipate robust profit-after-tax (PAT) growth.
  • The earnings season officially begins with Tata Consultancy Services reporting results today, followed by Avenue Supermarts on January 11.
Kotak Institutional Equities expects Q3FY25 net profits for the BSE-30 index to increase by 7.2% YoY, and for the Nifty-50 Index to grow by 9% YoY and 2.2% QoQ.

This earnings preview indicates ongoing challenges for many sectors, while also highlighting potential growth areas amid an overall subdued economic backdrop.
newTitle: Q3 Earnings Preview: Top Line Growth Likely to Remain Subdued for Seventh Consecutive Quarter

title: Manappuram Finance surges over 5% as RBI lifts curbs on subsidiary Asirvad Micro Finance; all you need to know - Upstox
summary:
Manappuram Finance Shares Rise 6% After RBI Lifts Restrictions on Asirvad Micro Finance

Date: January 9, 2024 | Source: Upstox

Manappuram Finance's shares surged by 6.4% following the Reserve Bank of India's decision to lift supervisory restrictions on its subsidiary, Asirvad Micro Finance. This comes after the RBI confirmed compliance with regulatory guidelines.

  • Manappuram Finance shares reached ₹191.50 on the NSE.
  • The RBI previously restricted loan sanctions due to serious supervisory concerns in October 2024.
  • The lifted restrictions come as both Asirvad Micro Finance and DMI Finance have revamped their loan pricing processes.
  • Manappuram Finance showed a surprising 2% rise in Q2 FY25 profit, which reached ₹571 crore.
  • Domestic gold prices surged during the quarter, boosting demand for gold loans.
“Now, having satisfied itself based on companies’ submissions, and in view of their adoption of revamped processes and systems...the Reserve Bank has decided to lift the aforementioned restrictions.”

The lifting of restrictions is expected to enhance Manappuram Finance's operational capabilities and market trust.
newTitle: Manappuram Finance Shares Rise 6% After RBI Lifts Restrictions on Asirvad Micro Finance
